desc: Students explore a little known dimension of Hemmingway--his life-long fascination with Africa--by traveling where he traveled and reading his writings about those places. Readings include Hemingway's Green Hills of Africa, "The Snows of Kilimanjaro," "The Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber," and Under Kilimanjaro. Through folklore and additional readings by western and East African authors, students experience and learn about the cultures Hemingway encountered and wrote about. Prerequisite: FYW. Offered alterate years during Interim.
name: Hemingway in East Africa
notes: This is an off-campus course. New course
prerequisites: Prerequisite: FYW. Offered alterate years during Interim.
